arts.ttl: Brighton 0-0 Brentford: Battling Bees pick up rare away point in Amex stalemate
arts.sum: Thomas Frank’s side secure just a second draw away from home this season, but lose both Mark Flekken and Ben Mee to injury

arts.ttl: 'Why would you do that?' | Was Joao Pedro fortunate not to see red for this?
arts.sum: Brighton's Joao Pedro was cleared of a red card by VAR and no further action was taken against the Brazilian after appearing to swing an elbow towards Brentford's Yehor Yarmolyuk .
Bees reaction. The post Frank praises ‘hugely impressive’ Brentford appeared first on West London Sport.

arts.ttl: Red or not? Frank says Brighton's Pedro should have gone
arts.sum: Joao Pedro avoided a red card despite swinging an elbow in Brighton's 0-0 draw with Brentford, but was he lucky to do so?

arts.ttl: Thomas Frank unhappy with officials in game with Brighton
arts.sum: Pedro escaped punishment after swinging an arm at Bees substitute substitute Yehor Yarmoliuk.

arts.ttl: Brighton frustrated by Brentford as winless run continues
arts.sum: Indeed, Brighton's Julio Enciso attempted eight shots alone in the first half - the most by a player in the opening 45 minutes of a Premier League match since Luis Suarez in Liverpool's 2-1 win at Aston Villa in March 2013 (also eight). Brighton & Hove Albion were left frustrated by Brentford after failing to score from an incredible 24 shots as their winless run extended to six matches in a goalless draw at the Amex Stadium.

arts.ttl: Lewis Dunk hits out at Brighton issue as fans boo after stalemate with Brentford
arts.sum: Lewis Dunk admits Brighton are in a sticky patch after a stalemate with Brentford

arts.ttl: João Pedro escapes red as Brighton’s winless run continues against Brentford
arts.athr: Ed Aarons at the Amex Stadium
arts.sum: When Brighton produced a stirring comeback to defeat Manchester City here back at the start of November and move into the top four, Fabian Hürzeler could have been forgiven for thinking that being a Premier League manager is a pretty straightforward business. Yet after another disappointing performance from his side that made it six matches without a victory and allowed Brentford to pick up only their second away point of the season, the 31-year-old is being forced to confront reality. Despite creating a plethora of chances, Brighton couldn’t find a way past Thomas Frank’s battling side, who lost their goalkeeper Mark Flekken to injury in the first half and handed a Premier League debut to Hákon Valdimarsson. For all their positivity and possession under Hürzeler, in the absence of top scorer Danny Welbeck – who has been sidelined during their winless run with an ankle injury – Brighton lack a cutting edge in attack that was exposed again. Continue reading...

arts.ttl: Brighton & Hove Albion 0-0 Brentford: Highlights, man of the match, stats as Seagulls fail to capitalize on chances
arts.sum: A resilient Brentford performance sees the Bees hold firm to deny Brighton & Hove Albion and secure a 0-0 draw in the Premier League on Friday night.

arts.ttl: Brighton frustrated in goalless draw with Brentford
arts.sum: Albion dominated for large periods on a foggy evening at the Amex Stadium
